title: Mobile Champions should deal at least 20-40% less damage in their full combo than Immobile Champions
body:
Mobility is a huge power increase and honestly mobile champions don't pay for that power increase by losing actual potential damage

They should lose a lot of damage by becoming super mobile

{{champion:45}} {{champion:63}}  should ALWAYS deal WAYYYYY more damage than {{champion:103}} {{champion:7}} 
{{champion:82}} {{champion:122}} should honestly out damage and out tank {{champion:59}} {{champion:150}}  in every possible scenario
{{champion:110}} should bring more to a team than {{champion:222}}{{champion:429}}   in every scenario and team comp

Mobility creep is fine if they actually pay for that mobility in some way

Why?

Mobility is not only power its utility
Its indirect tankiness
Its so useful in literally every capacity
Mobility champions can also deal damage far more often than immobile which alone spikes up their potential combo

replies.body:
I really can't see Ahri out damaging immobile mages like Brand, Viktor, Xerath, Anivia, or Vel'Koz in a team fight.

1v1, maybe.

Champs that don't have mobility need another sort of utility to survive. Things like Syndra's push, Veigars wall, Xerath's Range etc.

Champs that don't have any of these sort of tools are the ones that you never see anymore, like Karthus.

The problem is that Ahri has enough damage to kill you AND she's mobile

Sure, Brand can OVERKILL you but what good is that?

More than likely he'll just die after outputting his damage, whereas Ahri will live because of her innate safety and be around to continue being useful for her team.

So, yes, immobile champions need some sort of safety too, not more damage.

Well in a 1v1, Ahri would probably win (although it might just depend on who lands their CC first.) But League isn't a 1v1 game.

In a team fight, Brand will have a way bigger impact. What he brings to the team is his massive AOE damage, and he has his stun if someone charges him.

But his team should be trying to keep the enemy off him too. Granted, Tanks aren't as common as they should be, but thats another issue.

Yeah, that's not true at all.

Brand loses out on being unable to clear waves because, as an immobile champion, he'll get initiated on; Ahri can bait out these engages and protect her lane from the push.  Brand also cannot stay too far away from the turret, and must risk getting flanked and killed, because he needs to already be in position to do his damage; Ahri can use her mobility to stay in a safer position until the right moment to dash in and Charm someone.  Brand has to set up his CC, often with a very short range spell, AND then land the skillshot stun; Ahri can Charm from out of nowhere.

Essentially, Ahri does everything Brand does, but from a much safer position.  Yeah, if you are stupid enough to clump up, let the other team engage on you, and Brand can land his W and ult on multiple people, he'll do more damage.  It's the difference between theory and practice that makes him non-viable.  In theory, he does more damage.  In practice, he does no damage, because he is dead.

Let me correct you right here

In AN IDEAL SCENARIO FOR BRAND, he outclasses Ahri

The thing is, this ideal scenario is very rare AND although Ahri's best case scenario is not 100-0 the whole enemy team, it is much more easy to achieve. Ahri is much, much more reliable than Brand

Brand vs Ahri, how you seem to think it goes : The enemy team is all sitting in a bush, but they don't know it's warded. Brand's Jarvan promptly E-Q-Rs the whole enemy team, followed by a Leona ultimate. Brand uses his E-W-R combo and gets a pentakill

Brand vs Ahri, what really happens : Brands gets dove at level 6 and dies. Ahri proceeds to gank bot lane and snowballs her allies' lane. While posturing for objectives, she lands a charm on a target and her team deletes said target, creating a favorable situation for Ahri and her team.

I'm exaggerating, of course, but Ahri's inherent safety allows her to vastly outclass Brand, even though he does a SHITLOAD more damage than Ahri.

Now compare Ashe and Varus to Kalista and Graves
Compare Nautilus to Lee Sin, Jarvan or Vi

Champions with mobility have a massive advantage over immobile champions and they do not pay for it nearly enough. Immobile champions are a liability and they need to have MASSIVE strengths to be justifiable picks. And then, most of the time, you still need to complement these champions with very strong peel supports or tanks to even make them work.
Nerf Ahri for being useful...She only damages squishy champs TBH all you need is 1 {{item:3083}} And she won't kill you XD

You know many mid lanners that can build a warmog's and be useful?

I sure don't.

Vladimir.

Although I see the point you are trying to make.
At least before the ahri changes all her mobility was tied to her ultimate....

There's way too much to factor for just a strait up damage reduction. 

Veigar has one of the strongest stuns in the game(non ulti). Even after the changes it will still be very extreme. (I assume it'll get reduced to a .5 delay as well). If he farmed well his single target damage will be enough to rival Leblanc with fewer button presses and less counterplay. 

Brand will out damage all 3 of the other mages you listed in a teamfight. Short of a really bored Veigar in a custom game. 

Morde's ult keeps his power back. The power it brings to a team is top notch. We'll have to see where his rework takes him. Since his damage is going down in favor of tankiness, maybe he can get something else. He is in fact gaining a gimmicky MS buffs. 

Darius also out damages J4 and Gnar while not needing as many damage items(thus can build tankier). 

Your ADC comparisons I can agree with to a point though. But you're examples are a bit over the top. 
Varus needs some touch ups. He does bring quite a bit of damage to a teamfight. But a lot of his power is assuming he lands his R. Otherwise you could just bring Kog'Maw to do the same job Varus can. I personally think Varus' ulti should give him a Hurricane effect for 3 AA's at 30/50/70% damage. This will help spread his W and will proc as his R spreads as well. Even if it's a 1v1. Having minions around could make those extra shots give him more HP. 

Using Jinx is a bad example overall. As her and Darius both have combat effected MS buffs. Darius gain 5% MS for each stack of his passive. I'd say she has slightly less utility than Varus while having higher damage to make up for it though. I'd say she is for the most part a balanced ADC and would make a good example of what other ADC's power should feel like. Although this game cannot balance like that. 

And talking about Kalista is like talking about Cass. Everyone gets hot and bothered and no one really listens. 

IMO the real problem with the mobility creep is that it doesn't have any real counters. One of the main counters are point and click abilities. Something Riot tends to avoid. How about a new CC that disables mobility effects? It would be like a weaker silence. 
But I guess silences are not fun to watch in the LCS.

Veigars stun is getting raped in the next patch, Almost a full second delay along with warning Indicators. Which means he's never going to land it anyways. Which means his Dark matter is no longer a skill either. Q is being turned into a skillshot.

Brand will only outdamage if the team is all standing right next to each other and he can get w e and r off on everyone.

Mord is getting turned into a bruser with 0 CC meaning he won't even have  reason for people to TRY hurting him anymore, Everyone can just ignore him.

Those are just the one's i know about personally.

He's also gaining a range increase. He will still be able to get people inside of it. It was never intended to be an instant stun. And they have had to balance him around this stun. It's been known as one of the strongest non-ulti stuns in the game with no real counterplay for a very long time. These changes should not surprise anyone. It's a matter of making sure the rest of his kit continues to work. 

You're selling Brand too short and assuming the guy cannot land any abilities. By that logic Xerath needs buffs because you can avoid all of his skills while Brand at least has two targeted abilities.

THE RANGE IS A LIE , HIS ULT IS A CORE PART OF HIS BURST AND IT IS STILL 650!!! ITS LIKE FREAKING SYNDRA BEFORE THE BUFF!
sry all caps but im really getting tired of it.
And that range doesnt make up for the entire lose of an skill (GL landing Veigars W on non stunned targets)

Again, the stun was never meant to be used that way. 

And again, as long as the rest of his kit is made to match this he will be fine. If you think giving his R an increased range will be what he needs, voice it. Or even just an increase to those in his W. 

Does not change the fact his old W could not stay.

Nobody is going to ever be caught in his stun. Ever. .75 seconds is a HUGE delay. 

Ever had 750 ping? That's what it's going to be like. That's how LONG it will take. 

.75 seconds is far to long of a cast time for ANYTHING. You could be any champion in the game, standing on one side of the stun as he casts it. Walk to the other side (without boots.) and not get stunned.

Again, it was never meant to be an easy stun. It's a spell that says "sit here". But since those who got good with him could land it instantly, he had to be balanced around this. 

If .75 is too long it will likely be lowered or he will get more power in the rest of his kit.

I don't even know why youd have Jinx listed in there. Her passive only gives her a massive, short duration boost in movespeed when an enemy champion/tower dies if shes hit it in the last few seconds. Its kind of inconsequential when you compare it to the likes of Kalista, and she's even less mobile than ADCs like Graves/Lucian/Caitlyn who all have fairly low cooldown dashes.

The problem that seems to exist here is that highly mobile champions just tend to also have really overloaded kits in general. You've got Yasuo who has high mobility, high damage, solid protection from range through his windwall, and high control through his Q knockup and his ult, ontop of his passive shield. You've got Kalista who has high mobility, high damage, high objective control, and vision through her patrolling spirit, ontop of her ult that can be used to save her Oathsworn as well as initiation which gives her control through its knockup.

I cant understand how riot looks at these champion designs and gives them the OK. Wheres the weaknesses? Wheres the downside? Their older champions seem to be pretty solidly designed, with fairly clearly defined strengths and weaknesses that can be exploited. But the newer champions are just completely over the top that have a "we want our cake and want to eat it too" sort of mentality behind them.

They need to take the time and just rebalance a ton of champions at once in one massive patch or something. Either scaling up older champions to be on par with newer ones, or scaling down newer champions to make them more reasonably equipped.

Hint: Kalista and Yasuo are designed by the same guy.

Very well, let's start with champions who pay for it in different ways.

LeBlanc, Fizz, Kalista and Kassadin.

I feel that these champions pay for their mobility in different ways, but if the current state of the game has shown us anything, it's that champions who are considered to be the "worst" are all lacking reliable mobility. Movement speed buffs are generally much worse than dashes.

> Mobility should have a compromise, and currently it doesn't have any.

True on some champions, not on others.  There are tons of fair mobility champs in the game.

We just see the same dozen overtuned champs over and over.  This gives the impression that mobility is a problem, but really we have a much larger Jarvan problem than a general mobility problem.

Jarvan is precisely one of the most balanced mobile champions in this game. He has a fair mobility you can expect and counteract before he actually does it, also, it's not that easy to escape since it requires 1-1.5 seconds to put his flag and dash. Meanwhile Lee Sin will just kick you, dash to a ward and dash again to a jungle creep. Zed will spam a shadow and, even if you stun him, he wil press WWWWWWWWWW until he gets rid of the stun for 0.1 sec and insta-teleports to his shadow. LeBlanc... well, we all know how ridiculously hard is that champion to kill even when she has 1,500 HP late game.

It's not just mobility.  Champions tend not to pay enough in raw damage for utility in general.

A random example would be {{champion:61}}, who doesn't have that much lower damage/ratios than a normal mage, but has much more utility and zone control.

The problem is that it's hard to put an accurate value on something like utility.  Raw damage is much easier to balance than utility or mobility.
